DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to represent the overall disease response in a target, non-target, or new lesion using the iRECIST criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information relating to the overall lesion response.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Including everything.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredDefinition: Response; a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Concepts.definition: Any act or phenomena, or behavior, constituting a reply or reaction of a living organism or its part to some foregoing stimulus or agent.

Property.changeDescription: Denise Warzel updated Definition by seraching NCI Thesaurus in Admin tool.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: irRECIST: Immune-related Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST)-2013
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/7/18 jk added irRECIST CSI.  8/30/17 tt transferred context, added registration status and CSI per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._iRECIST: guidelines for response criteria for use in trials testing immunotherapeutics. (Seymour L, Bogaerts J, Perrone A, Ford R, Schwartz LH, Mandrekar S, Lin NU, Litiere S, Dancey J, Chen A, Hodi FS, Therasse P, Hoekstra OS, Shankar LK, Wolchok JD, Ballinger M, Caramella C, de Vries EG; RECIST working group. iRECIST: guidelines for response criteria for use in trials testing immunotherapeutics. Lancet Oncol. 2017 Mar;18(3):e143-e152.)_Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having been established or verified.: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity.

Concepts.definition: A clinical, pathologic, and/or molecular finding indicating that the course of a disease is worsening in terms of extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: User curated long name to support DCI, Modified RANO, ghd, 04.24.18

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

Concepts.definition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity but the criteria for progressive disease is not met.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

Concepts.definition: A disease that is neither decreasing nor increasing in extent or severity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

Concepts.definition: A finding indicating that there is a decrease in the size and the extent of tissue involvement by a malignant tumor in a patient.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

Concepts.definition: The disappearance of all signs of cancer in response to treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors Type
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.longName: Immune-Modified Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors
Concepts.definition: A modification of the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST), version 1.1, for use as a standard approach to solid tumor measurements and definitions for objective change in tumor size in cancer clinical trials in which an immunotherapy is used.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.origin: iRECIST:  Immune Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST)-2017
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/22/19 jk released per DCI/Annie's review.  7/19/19 jk VD versioned to add PV "Not done", chg LN, increase max length.   10/22/18 tmt Transferred from DCI to NCI Standards context as part of RECIST FG content.  Changes should not be made to this VD without coordinating with DCI/Duke (Michael D. Leonard, Annie Tsui, Michael Goodin).Curated to support Immunotherapy Response Protocol

DataElement.origin: iRECIST:  Immune Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumours (RECIST)-2017
DataElement.changeDescription: 7/22/19 jk released per DCI/Annie's review.   7/19/19 jk CDE versioned for new VD version due to max length increase, new PV (Not done) for DCI MEL_PPD1_101803 study.  10/22/18 jk versioned to chg SN from system-generated to text.  10/7/18 jk Released per Fall 2018 Content Team review.  8/7/18 jk created based on iRECIST guideline.
